result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark J. Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Submit to DNA sample.  Undergo any other counseling per agent.    If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes:
Jail to commence on or before July 10, 2015; unless agent states sooner.
Consecutive to: any other sentences or commitments.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mark J. Anderson in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea to Count 1.   Attorney Middleton gives joint agreement reached.  State agrees.  Defendant agrees and understands.  No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court. finds Defendant guilty.  Court withholds sentence.
Count 1:
2 years Probation
30 days Sauk County jail with work release privileges.  Jail to commence on or before July 10, 2015 at 6 p.m.  Unless agent states sooner.  
Submit to DNA sample
Undergo any counseling per agent.
AODA & treatment
$268.00 costs & $250.00 DNA surcharge & Supervision Fees (PAID THRU PROBATION)

Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 2.  Arraignment scheduled for January 14, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on December 19, 2014 at 11:15 am.

Defendant Mark J. Anderson in court with attorney Deb O'Rourke o/b/o Thomas L. Steinman who is in trial today.  Linda A. Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Reset so DE can talk w/atty. Steinman.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 19, 2014 at 11:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on December 3, 2014 at 11:15 am.

Defendant Mark J. Anderson in court with attorney Thomas L. Steinman.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Steinman states offer is outstanding and still in negotiations.  Requests prelim be set/time limits cont'd waived.  Bond continued. Attorney Thomas L. Steinman in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Steinman has no explanation for nonappearance.  State requests warrant.  Based on non-appearance, court authorized warrant and orders cash bond forfeiture begin.

Special bond conditions as follows:  No poss. of controlled substances w/o valid prescription; Absolute Sobriety of alcohol & controlled substances.  Not operate m/v w/o valid DL.
